---
title: "Houses Summary Stat"
author: "Jannis Dietze"
date: "2025-05-09"
output: pdf_document
---



```{r load data}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(sf)
library(dplyr)
library(stargazer)

# Load spatial data
DD_houses_rentals <- read_sf("~/spatial and environmental economic research/Project/EMP-project_EmissionImpact_on_Housing_prices_DD/Housing prices shp/DDMH_STVSCHdaynight_25833.shp", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Drop geometry to avoid issues with stargazer
DD_df <- DD_houses_rentals %>% st_drop_geometry()

# Convert all numeric-like characters to numbers (if needed)
DD_df <- DD_df %>%
  mutate(across(everything(), ~ ifelse(is.character(.), as.numeric(gsub(",", ".", .)), .)))

# Select only numeric columns
numeric_vars <- DD_df %>% select(where(is.numeric))

```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r table}
stargazer(numeric_vars, type = "latex", title = "Summary Statistics of Numeric Variables", digits = 2)

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
